content.description: A fun, varied route up a cool feature, with a contrived finish.Climb the right side of the ledgy face past three bolts. Jam the splitter offwidth on the left side of the arete, using the tips crack here and there. Place your only small cam in the top of the tips crack, swing right on a jug rail, and mantel onto the ledge. Layback the sharp arete (resist the barndoor!) past two bolts to the top of the Rocketship.Rap from two-bolt chain anchor.
content.protection: 1x blue metolius or equivalent, 1x 3-5" cams5 lead bolts
content.location: This route essentially climbs the arete of the rocketship-shaped pillar on the far right side of the Choss-a-theatre. It starts with bolts on the right side of a ledgy face (the bolts on the left side are for Blastoffwidth!).

content.description: This route is a good first trad lead. Climb good edges to gain the crack. Jam the handcrack to a two-bolt anchor atop the pillar. Shares anchor with Balanced Diet.
content.protection: Single set 1-4" cams + optional extra 2-3" cams
content.location: Corner handcrack that forms the left side of a pillar. The camouflaged two-bolt chain anchor hangs from the top of the pillar.

content.description: Climb the left side of the ledgy face past three bolts. Burl up the wide left-facing corner formed by the left side of the Rocketship.Rap from two-bolt chain anchor.
content.location: This route climbs up through the left-facing corner on the left side of the rocketship-shaped pillar on the far right side of the Choss-a-theatre. It starts with bolts on the left side of a ledgy face (the bolts on the right side are for It's Not Rocket Surgery).

content.description: This mixed gear/bolt line shares its anchor with Dacite Daydream. Start up jugs to a high first bolt; if this bolt seems uncomfortably high, feel free to drop a .75 Camalot in the horizontal below the step-up. Continue up the tricky seam past two more bolts. Try not to grab the pine sapling! - plenty of rock holds are there. Follow the thin crack up to a rest, then finish on the glory handcrack.
content.location: Bolted seam to a handcrack on a black plaque. Down and right from Dacite Daydream; the two routes share a two-bolt chain anchor atop the pillar.

content.description: The name more or less speaks for itself but a cool feature none the less. It is home to a few lines with some potential for more.
